intro: Synotis austroyunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan synotis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and similar species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories or on rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
